snippet: Indigenous methods of water conservation from rural India might offer solutions to cities.
abstract: Indigenous methods of water conservation from rural India might offer solutions to cities.
lead_paragraph: “India’s monsoon rains are retreating this week, a delayed end to a yearly wet season that has become ever more unpredictable as a result of global warming,” Cheryl Colopy wrote in The OP-ED section of The New York Times. “Of all the challenges that face India,” she wrote, “few are more pressing than how it manages water.”
